content.raw: I kept it for consistency with the `sdf::Gui *Gui() const` accessor function. Thinking about it a little more,  a const pointer makes sense in this case. I’ve updated it in [a8bdbc8](#!/osrf/sdformat/commits/a8bdbc8eebf7339c5db1ce4d138b0eab1537be2a)
content.html: I kept it for consistency with the sdf::Gui *Gui() const accessor function. Thinking about it a little more, a const pointer makes sense in this case. I’ve updated it in a8bdbc8

content.raw: On second thought, it's probably more efficient to reassign the pointers after checking equality instead of moving the data.

content.raw: Maybe check if `this->dataPtr != _scene.dataPtr` before assigning? Alternatively, `*this->dataPtr = std::move(*_scene.dataPtr)`.
content.html: Maybe check if this->dataPtr != _scene.dataPtr before assigning? Alternatively, *this->dataPtr = std::move(*_scene.dataPtr).

content.raw: LGTM, I just have some minor comments.
content.html: LGTM, I just have some minor comments.

The assignment operators don't show up as covered. The same is happening to other classes though.

Maybe something like this triggers it?

sdf::Scene scene2;
scene2 = std::move(scene);

content.raw: Do we want to initialize them to the [default value](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=scene#scene_ambient) in the spec?
content.html: Do we want to initialize them to the default value in the spec?

content.raw: Passing by const value in function declarations is [discouraged](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/readability-avoid-const-params-in-decls.html), but I don't think we're enforcing it
content.html: Passing by const value in function declarations is discouraged, but I don't think we're enforcing it
